explanation: We use the two-pointer technique, starting from both ends of the string. We skip any non-alphanumeric characters (spaces, punctuation) and compare the remaining characters case-insensitively. If all pairs match as we move inward, it's a palindrome. Time complexity is O(n) where n is the string length, and space complexity is O(1) since we only use two pointers.
